description:
About the job
About Our Company
Millennium Nexus, Beyond Apps Group company (www.beyond-apps-group.com), is hiring.
 We use state-of-the-art trends and technologies to develop unique & awesome products with enhanced features. Our major product lines use technologies such as Computer Vision & Image Processing, Machine Learning, VR & AI, Multi-Camera Live Streaming and extensive mobile development. 
Our products, which cover several markets, include the following: 
· Professional quality multi-live broadcasting for consumers and enterprises
· Video & photo editing for consumers and professional content creators
· Unique global real estate property management and property listings
· Global yacht/boat listings, services, and marina management
Our dedication to creating an exceptional workplace extends from Silicon Valley’s proven management experience and principles to all our teams and locations.
 We are certain that working with our highly-skilled team would be one of the greatest experiences of your career. 
 Job Title
Sales Development Representative (SDR) 
 Your Contributions
  Job Description:
 We are looking for a dynamic and results-driven Sales Development Representative (SDR) to join our team. The SDR will be responsible for prospecting, qualifying, and generating new sales leads to support our marketing & sales team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for sales, excellent communication skills, and a strong work ethic.
 Responsibilities:
· Prospect and qualify leads through cold calling, email campaigns, and other outreach methods to introduce our platform and invite users to sign up for user acquisition. 
· Clearly communicate the value proposition and benefits of our platform, promoting our services to prospective users. 
· Build relationships with users, securing commitments to join our platform and utilize our services. 
· Maintain leads, closely tracking progress through the onboarding process. 
· Consistently meet or exceed user acquisition targets. 
· Provide regular updates and reports on user acquisition progress to the Management team, ensuring clear communication and alignment on objectives. 
· Deliver excellent customer service, addressing any inquiries or concerns that users may have in a timely and professional manner. 
 Required Qualifications:
· Proven experience as a Sales Development Representative or similar role
· Strong English communication and interpersonal skills
· Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
· Goal-oriented with a strong drive for results
· Familiarity with CRM software and sales processes
· Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or related field is preferred.
 Preferably with sales experience in the real estate industry or a strong understanding of the real estate agent market
    What We Offer You
· Competitive compensation
· Exciting work environment and challenging projects
· Excellent growth opportunity
  If you are looking for challenging opportunities in an exciting up-and-coming international company and want to make your mark, we would love to hear from you.
 You can view the product we are hiring for at ziba-property.com or download the app “Ziba Property” from the Apple store or Google store.

    Please forward your resume to: career@beyond-apps-group.com
skills: EnglishCold Calling, Customer Relationship Management (CRM), Lead Generation, Marketing, Sales Development, Sales Prospecting, Sales and Marketing, and Teamwork

description:
About the job
Ibex, for one of it's global client, is looking to hire Data Visualization Specialist (UX).
Responsibilities:
Developing and maintaining design wire-frames and specifications
Collaborating with visual designers and creative directors to incorporate a visual or brand identity into the end product
Communicating screen designs, interaction models, end-to-end experiences, and the target audience to other members of the project team
Considering the human-computer interface element of a design
Comparing the user experience of existing applications and working to design better alternatives
Keeping current with industry trends and competitor products, and communicating design prototypes and ideas to developers
Working with UI Designers to implement attractive designs
Developing task flows and wireframes based on user needs
Requirements:
Bachelors in CS or relevant field
Expert in designing reports for user experience (UX design)
Expert at writing principles for cohesive reporting systems
Proactive, organized, Diligent & detail oriented
Good understanding of Power BI
Comfortable in EST time zone (Evening/night - Work from home)

About the job
Who We Are

Motive empowers the people who run physical operations with tools to make their work safer, more productive, and more profitable. For the first time ever, safety, operations and finance teams can manage their drivers, vehicles, equipment, and fleet related spend in a single system. Combined with industry leading AI, the Motive platform gives you complete visibility and control, and significantly reduces manual workloads by automating and simplifying tasks.

Motive serves more than 120,000 customers – from Fortune 500 enterprises to small businesses – across a wide range of industries, including transportation and logistics, construction, energy, field service, manufacturing, agriculture, food and beverage, retail, and the public sector.

Visit gomotive.com to learn more.

About The Role

As a Software Engineer - Machine Learning, you will be a part of a passionate team whose mission is to bring intelligence to the world’s trucks. The team is focused on building technology to understand driving behavior, identify risk factors, and intelligently suggest coachable events that not only improve the fleet safety and potentially save millions of dollars but also contribute to making the roads safer. You will have a unique opportunity to work with a high-caliber and fast-paced team which consists of experienced researchers and engineers in Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Robotics with a track record of previous products and top-tier publications.

You will play a critical role in building and improving a technology that will be used by millions of trucks. In this role, you will design and implement complex machine-learning systems. You will have the opportunity to build and/or improve ML/computer vision systems. Identify where models and algorithms are failing, debug issues, propose solutions, implement, and deploy them on millions of trucks. You will also get exposure to large-scale ML infra and scaling that facilitates large amounts of data to train, test, and validate computer vision systems.

What You’ll Do

Evaluate and improve the performance of existing models and algorithms already in production
Prototype and implement ML modules for complex AI features
Build and optimize CV/ML algorithms for real-time performance so they can run on our embedded platform, i.e., the next-gen AI dashcam
Write proficient Python and C++ code to build and improve CV algorithms, ML services, training, model compression, and porting pipelines
Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Embedded, Backend, Frontend, Hardware, QA, and the broader AI team to ensure the development of robust and sustainable AI systems
Build automated deployment, validation, and active learning pipelines.

What We’re Looking For

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field. A Master’s degree is a plus. 
5+ years of machine learning and/or data science experience
Solid mathematical foundation in Deep Learning, Machine Learning, and optimization approaches.
Strong experience in Python or C++
Experience in the following tools and technologies is a plus. AWS (SageMaker, Lambda, EC2, S3, RDS), CI/CD, Terraform, Docker, and Kubernetes.
Prior experience with optimizing and deploying ML models on embedded devices is a strong plus

Creating a diverse and inclusive workplace is one of Motive's core values. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. 

Please review our Candidate Privacy Notice here.

The applicant must be authorized to receive and access those commodities and technologies controlled under U.S. Export Administration Regulations. It is Motive's policy to require that employees be authorized to receive access to Motive products and technology.

About the job
Devsinc is looking for an experienced Python developer to join our engineering team and help us create dynamic software applications for our clients. In this role, you will be responsible for writing and testing scalable code, developing back-end components, and integrating user-facing elements in collaboration with front-end developers.

To be successful as a Python developer, you should possess in-depth knowledge of object-relational mapping, experience with server-side logic, and above-average knowledge of Python programming. Ultimately, a top-class Python developer is able to design highly responsive web-applications that perfectly meet the needs of the client.

Python Developer Responsibilities:

Coordinating with development teams to determine application requirements
Writing scalable code using Python programming language
Testing and debugging applications
Developing back-end components
Integrating user-facing elements using server-side logic
Assessing and prioritizing client feature requests
Integrating data storage solutions
Coordinating with front-end developers
Reprogramming existing databases to improve functionality
Developing digital tools to monitor online traffic


Requirements

Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, or related field
3-5 years of experience as a Python developer
Expert knowledge of Python and related frameworks including Django and Flask
A deep understanding and multi-process architecture and the threading limitations of Python
Ability to integrate multiple data sources into a single system
Familiarity with testing tools
Ability to collaborate on projects and work independently when required


Benefits

Private Health Insurance
Pension Plan
Paid Time Off
Work From Home
Training & Development
Performance Bonus

About the job
About us:

CureMD excels in providing advanced tools and technologies that empower healthcare professionals to make informed decisions about patient care. Our state-of-the-art solutions harness the power of data analytics, artificial intelligence, and machine learning to analyze patient information, decipher patterns, and render actionable insights. These advanced technologies equip physicians with profound insights into each patient's health, enabling them to formulate precise diagnoses, implement highly effective treatment strategies, and deliver top quality care with ease.

Job Overview:

The Application Security Analyst at CureMD is a crucial member of our security team responsible for safeguarding our applications, data, and systems against potential security threats and vulnerabilities. This position offers a unique opportunity for professional growth and skill development within the field of application security. As an Application Security Analyst, you will work under the guidance of experienced security professionals, gaining hands-on experience in identifying and addressing security risks.

Essential Job Responsibilities:

Security Assessments.
Ability to exploit recognized vulnerabilities and discover new vulnerabilities.
Analyzing and auditing the Source code of the Web/Mobile Application.
Proficiency in scripting, Unix operating systems and windows.
Proficient in Linux operating system configuration, utilities, and programming,
Conducted manual external and internal penetration testing.
Conduct Penetration testing/ Vulnerabilities Assessment for Cloud based web, desktop, and mobile apps.
Perform static and dynamic code testing, manual code inspection, threat modeling, design reviews to identify vulnerabilities and security defects
Keep up with the latest methods for ethical hacking and testing and are always evaluating new penetration testing tools
Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders
Assist in Security operational tasks.

Required Qualifications:

Bachelors in Information/Cyber Security, Information Technology, Computer Science or Software Engineering with majors in Information Security.
Having 1 - 2 years of relevant experience
Good understanding of security tools and technologies for performing Penetration Testing.
Have Knowledge of different coding languages.

Compensation and Benefits:

Competitive base salary and a yearly bonus.
Health benefits (Outpatient, Inpatient, Maternity, Inpatient for Parents).
Provident Fund company matches up to 8% of the base salary.
Company-sponsored trainings, workshops, education, and development programs.
Collaborative yet fun-loving atmosphere: space that fosters employee wellbeing.
Commuter support, supportive workspaces, gym facility, and daycare.
Car Financing Policy.
skills: Computer ScienceAnalytical Skills, Ethical Hacking, Incident Response, Malware Analysis, Penetration Testing, System Configuration, Threat Modeling, Vulnerability Assessment, and Vulnerability Management

Understanding of software engineering practices.

Can effectively communicate in both spoken and written English.

Job Benefits:

Collaborate with leading experts worldwide and become part of a network tailored to your aspirations
Enjoy remote work flexibility with no traditional job constraints
Competitive salary based on global standards in USD
Contribute to pioneering projects that push technological boundaries, keeping you at the forefront of your field.

Join us now and advance your career. Take the tests and multiple-choice questions today to increase your chances of securing one of our exciting positions. Seize this opportunity to play a pivotal role in our mission and transform the technology landscape for all.

About the job
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, IgniteTech. Have you got what it takes?

The software development industry is rapidly evolving, driven by the imperative to enhance development speed, reduce human error, and elevate code quality. These enhancements are crucial as they correlate directly with faster product time-to-market and heightened customer satisfaction. The average time for software deployment has historically lagged due to traditional coding practices, with an estimated 30% of projects exceeding their timeline due to inefficiencies and errors.

IgniteTech is leading the transformation, integrating advanced GenAI technologies to redefine software architecture and development. Unlike traditional roles that focus on incremental improvements, this position offers the thrilling opportunity to lead pivotal AI-driven initiatives. You will be at the forefront of integrating AI to not just enhance, but revolutionize software development processes and outcomes, significantly boosting efficiency and competitiveness on a strategic level.

This role is designed for those who are driven to be at the cutting edge of technology and innovation. It is not merely an operational or task-oriented position; it is a strategic role that involves extensive research and development, prototyping, and the application of AI in crafting next-generation software solutions. Ideal candidates are those who are not only proficient in AI and software architecture but are also visionary in their approach to leveraging technology for business innovation.

In this role, you will lead our team in shaping the architectural frameworks and strategies that integrate AI into our software solutions. This role is integral to our mission, and your work will directly influence the productivity and quality of our deliverables. We invite you to join us if you are passionate about pushing the boundaries of technology and eager to make a tangible impact in the software industry.

What You Will Be Doing

Design the overarching architecture for AI-driven systems that automate complex aspects of software development, such as architecture generation, dependency management, and advanced predictive coding.
Deep dive into the latest developments in AI and software engineering by participating in R&D initiatives, attending conferences, and engaging with academic and professional communities. When a new AI technology comes out, we need to be among the first to know about it.

What You Won’t Be Doing

Routine Code Maintenance: Regular updating or debugging of existing software code to fix minor issues or improve functionality.
Standard Software Development: Basic coding or software development tasks that involve implementing straightforward features or functionalities without AI integration.

Back End Developer Key Responsibilities

Use your engineering expertise to bring about a significant increase in development speed, reduction in human error, and improvement in code quality, ultimately leading to faster time-to-market for software products and enhanced customer satisfaction.

Basic Requirements

At least 3 years of professional experience implementing impactful initiatives as a software engineer
Familiarity with GenAI code assistants (e.g., Github Copilot, Cursor.sh, v0.dev)
Previous experience successfully implementing Generative AI products/projects/solutions/tools
Previous experience leveraging different LLMs (e.g., GPT, Claude, Mistral) to solve business problems

About IgniteTech

If you want to work hard at a company where you can grow and be a part of a dynamic team, join IgniteTech!

Through our portfolio of leading enterprise software solutions, we ignite business performance for thousands of customers globally. We’re doing it in an entirely remote workplace that is focused on building teams of top talent and operating in a model that provides challenging opportunities and personal flexibility.

A career with IgniteTech is challenging and fast-paced. We are always looking for energetic and enthusiastic employees to join our world-class team.

We offer opportunities for personal contribution and promote career development. IgniteTech is an Affirmative Action, Equal Opportunity Employer that values the strength that diversity brings to the workplace.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!

Working with Crossover

This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.

What to expect next:

You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.

Important! If you do not receive an email from us:

First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

Crossover Job Code: LJ-5269-PK-Lahore-BackEndDevelop.001

description:
About the job
We are seeking a highly motivated and dynamic individual to join our team as an Associate Sales Manager in the real estate sector. The Associate Sales Manager will be responsible for assisting in sales activities, coordinating with clients, and supporting the sales team to achieve targets. This role requires excellent communication skills, a strong understanding of the real estate market, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Key Responsibilities:
Assist in the development and implementation of sales strategies to achieve company targets.
Collaborate with the sales team to identify new business opportunities and generate leads.
Build and maintain relationships with clients, providing exceptional customer service and addressing any inquiries or concerns.
Conduct market research to stay updated on industry trends, competitor activities, and customer preferences.
Assist in the preparation of sales presentations, proposals, and contracts.
Coordinate property viewings and accompany clients during site visits.
Support the sales team in negotiations and closing deals with prospective buyers or tenants.
Maintain accurate records of sales activities, including client interactions, sales calls, and deal progress.
Assist in organizing promotional events and marketing campaigns to increase brand awareness and attract potential clients.
Collaborate with other departments such as marketing, finance, and legal to ensure smooth execution of sales transactions.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Real Estate, or a related field.
Proven experience in sales or real estate, with a strong track record of achieving targets.
Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
Knowledge of real estate laws, regulations, and procedures.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment and independently with minimal supervision.
Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.
Proficiency in MS Office and CRM software.
Valid driver's license and access to a reliable vehicle.
Preferred Qualifications:
Previous experience in a sales management or leadership role.
Certification in real estate sales or brokerage.
Familiarity with local market trends and property development projects.
Fluency in multiple languages, particularly those commonly spoken in the local area.

Location: Lahore
skills: CommunicationBusiness Development, Customer Interaction, Estate Sales, Market Research, Marketing, Negotiation, Real Estate, Sales Presentations, and Sales Strategy

description:
About the job
About the Role

Are you passionate about pushing the boundaries of innovation and driving business initiatives with cutting-edge AI and machine learning solutions? Join our team and help shape the future!

We are looking for a dynamic and experienced Senior Technical ML/AI Lead to join our team. In this key role, you will lead the definition and development of custom AI and ML applications to meet the evolving needs of our products. You will collaborate closely with internal stakeholders to gather requirements, translate them into actionable specifications, and ensure successful project execution in partnership with R&D and development teams. The ideal candidate will have a strong blend of technical expertise, project management skills, and excellent communication abilities.

Key Responsibilities

- Leadership and Team Building: Lead and mentor a team of AI/ML professionals.
- Stakeholder Collaboration and Communication: Engage with stakeholders to understand their AI/ML needs and communicate solutions effectively.
- Model Development: Design and implement supervised, unsupervised, and deep learning models.
- Continuous Learning and Innovation: Stay abreast of the latest AI/ML trends and technologies to drive innovation.

Qualifications

- 3+ years of hands-on experience in applied AI research, with progressively senior or lead roles.
- Expertise in developing AI/ML applications on large-scale unstructured text data using deep learning, transformers, and LLMs.
- Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and Node.js.
- Experience with machine learning architectures (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, AlexNet, LSTM, Conformers, BERT, etc.).
- Proven ability to lead and manage cross-functional teams.
- Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
- Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.

Preferred Qualifications

- Experience with cloud-native tools that accelerate analytic development (e.g., AWS SageMaker, AWS RedShift, AWS Fargate, Google Cloud BigQuery, Google Cloud Vertex AI, or Google Cloud Run).
- Experience with ML Ops pipelines for continuous evaluation, improvement, and deployment.
- Strong project management skills.

If you are inetereted please share your resume at hiring.gsoftconsulting.com

About the job
Job Overview

CONVO is looking for a passionate and experienced Machine Learning/Data Analyst Manager to lead our growing team of data analysts and machine learning engineers. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and executing our data science strategy, overseeing the entire data analysis lifecycle, and translating complex data insights into actionable business recommendations.

Location: Islamabad | Hybrid

Responsibilities

Lead and manage a team of data analysts and machine learning engineers.
Define the data science roadmap and research priorities aligned with business goals.
Develop and implement a comprehensive data analysis strategy, including data collection, cleaning, transformation, and analysis.
Build and deploy machine learning models to solve real-world business problems.
Translate complex data insights into clear, concise, and actionable recommendations for stakeholders.
Champion a data-driven culture within the organization.
Ensure the quality, accuracy, and integrity of data assets.
Develop and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders across various departments.
Stay up-to-date on the latest advancements in machine learning and data analysis techniques.
Leverage the business understanding to define the daily activities and tasks of the project team.
Manage a strong and continuous interaction with the product team to determine the most suitable analytics solution for the specific business case.

Qualifications

Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field (PhD preferred).
Minimum 08 years of experience in a data science or machine learning role.
CPG / FMCG industry knowledge is an advantage
Proven experience leading and managing a team of data analysts and/or machine learning engineers.
Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms and statistical concepts.
Experience with programming languages like Python and SQL.
Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI).
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to think strategically and translate data insights into actionable business recommendations.
Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines

What We Have For You

Great compensation package, provident fund, EOBI, medical benefits for you and your family, free lunch, Bi-annual performance-tied increments & performance recognition awards and a great lean and agile work culture!

Convo endorses a culture of diversity in all aspects and aims to build a diverse team of amazing individuals!

description:
About the job
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Skyvera. Have you got what it takes?

In today's hyper-connected world, network downtime and hardware failures can cripple businesses, costing time, money, and reputation. The industry is plagued with inefficiencies and vulnerabilities, making high network and hardware uptime more critical than ever. Skyvera is rewriting the rulebook by integrating advanced network management with hands-on data center operations. Our engineers leverage cutting-edge technology and top-tier equipment to ensure our clients stay ahead of the curve, setting new standards for reliability and performance.

At Skyvera, we believe in a proactive approach to network and data center management. Unlike typical industry roles, this position uniquely combines expertise in both advanced network management and data center operations, offering a dynamic and multifaceted work environment. This dual focus not only differentiates us from others but also keeps the role exciting and challenging, allowing our engineers to stay ahead of industry standards.

In this role, you will be an integral part of a team dedicated to maintaining and optimizing our network and data center operations. Your expertise will help drive our mission to provide reliable, secure, and efficient network solutions. If you are passionate about working with cutting-edge technology, leading industry equipment, and thrive in a dynamic environment, we encourage you to apply and join us in revolutionizing network and data center management.

What You Will Be Doing

Network Management: Configure and maintain networking systems, including Cisco and F5 equipment, troubleshoot and resolve network issues, and implement robust security measures.
Data Center Management: Maintain and manage data center equipment, coordinate with providers for hardware issues, and ensure the data center is organized and efficient.
System Maintenance and Upgrades: Perform regular hardware maintenance, conduct firmware and OS updates, support software upgrades, and manage equipment moves, migrations, and recycling.
Incident Management: Monitor systems using various tools, manage customer circuits and SDWAN appliances, and administer Windows and Linux systems to ensure quick and effective incident response.

Network Architect Key Responsibilities

Ensure high network and hardware uptime

Basic Requirements

At least 3 years of experience in network and data center management, routing configuration, and troubleshooting
Proficiency in using Cisco network equipment and F5 load balancers
Experience with hardware servers management and preventative maintenance practices
Proficiency in Windows and Linux administration
Experience with SDWAN appliances
Knowledge of SIP and SBC basics
Ability to support hardware maintenance, firmware, and OS updates

About the job
About Afiniti

At Afiniti, we are a leading provider of artificial intelligence technology that elevates the customer experience by making moments of human connection more valuable. Our mission is rooted in a simple yet powerful idea: understanding patterns of human behavior enables us to predict how people will interact and create meaningful connections.

Using our patented AI technology, we revolutionize the contact center industry by pairing customers with the most compatible contact center agents. By doing so, we enhance the entire customer journey, resulting in exceptional experiences and improved outcomes for all parties involved.

About the Role
This position sits in the Group HR Data & Analytics team, reporting to the UK-based HR Data & Analytics Manager. The team provide data, reporting and analysis to HR colleagues and leaders across the world, as well as monitoring the quality of data held in our SAP SuccessFactors HRIS and other databases.

Run reports to schedule and ad hoc as required, providing accurate and relevant data to other teams and functions that feeds business processes and enables data-led decision making.
Manage positions in the HRIS, creating, amending and closing as required by the business.
Support the move to globally consistent, automated processes by joining project teams to represent data requirements and identify data points that allow us to measure the benefits of new processes and deliver further refinements.

About The Role

Professional Services Engineer

A professional services group member is cross-functional, multi-skilled individual who must perform tasks which are usually done by separate and many different teams.

The qualities that the professional services group seeks are intelligence, the ability and willingness to learn, independent mindedness, and a sense of humour.

Key Responsibilities

In addition to knowing the Airo product end-to-end, a PS team member is expected to perform the following activities:

Client Communication: Speak daily with clients around the world. Respond over mail and chat within a single business day. Explain the Airo product and it's benefit to the client. Field client questions and respond to their concern. Work with Afiniti sales and partnership teams and provide technical and product guidance in support of the sales process.
Business and Data Analysis: Understand the business benefit of Afiniti Know the basic concepts behind metric identification and optimization, A/B testing via Afiniti ON/OFF benchmarks, modelling vs. simulation Have an intermediate level competence in SQL Understand how ETL processes works Explain Airo data requirements to the client Understand and capture the details of the clients’ data environments and data sources and identify which ones will be of use to Airo Help the client design data pipelines and databases using the data formats specified by Airo Write SQL and custom scripts using Bash, Python, and/or PowerShell to build data pipelines. Should have basic knowledge of Bash, Python, and/or PowerShell or learn one of them very quickly on the job Should be able to use Excel with at least an intermediate level of competence
Airo Installation: Install Airo application in test environments (as well as help build test environments) as well as in production Understand the Airo installation script and process in full details, know and be able to install its prerequisites, and be aware of their quirks/shortfalls Identify issues with installation, fix and/or report them.
Liaising with Tier 3 support: Identify problems with Airo product. Communicate them clearly via written reports and verbal discussions. Create bug reports to help fix bugs and problems with the product for engineering teams (Tier 3). Suggest improvement to products in concrete terms and offer technical solutions to problems. Write user stories and feature requests to help materialize the new features for engineering teams (Tier 3).
Routing and Telephony: Basic understanding of the concept behind VoIP. Full grasp of basic telephony terminology (examples: dial plan, call path, call control). Understand how Afiniti core routing engine works and know about its constituent parts. Understand Avaya/Cisco/Genesys terminology and be able to describe their products.
Infrastructure and Networks: Intermediate to advanced competence in the use of Linux (preferably Redhat based distros) Able to troubleshoot problems on the shell via Unix Core Utilities. Basic understanding of what containers are, how to run, load, and save them. Understand IP networks and recognize common problems that arise on IP networks. Have a clear understanding of the importance of data security and should be able to identify common uses and practices that will result in data breaches, unauthorized access, or loss of data.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in (preferably) Computer Science or Electrical/Electronic Engineering.
Exceptional experience and work history will be considered in lieu of formal CS/EE education.

Preferred Qualifications

1 to 4 years of experience.
Understanding of Business product (Airo).
Excellent written and verbal communication skills along with proficiency in telephony switches (e.g. Cisco, Avaya), Linux, SQL, Python, Bash, PowerShell.

Location/Hybrid work statement

 Based on the role and function at Afiniti, you need to adopt a hybrid work model.

Collaboration: They often work with other departments to understand their data needs and help them make informed decisions based on data insights.

Detect, examine, and decode trends or patterns within intricate datasets.

Goals development, tracking and management.

description:
About the job
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?

Are you at the pinnacle of your career, with a decade of experience steering B2B SaaS products toward market success? Are you interested in working at the cutting edge of generative AI, pioneering its application in product development?

Trilogy's portfolio includes over 100 B2B software companies and acquires more every year. In our view, every industry will be disrupted by Generative AI, and all of our products must embrace it. In this role, you will be responsible for setting the GenAI product vision for our entire portfolio of companies. In so doing, you will delve into the customer mindset, involving deep analysis of market trends, customer behavior, and product profitability, and determine how we can leverage GenAI to maximize customer value. Your strategic decisions will significantly influence our products' market positioning and profitability, driving both customer satisfaction and business success.

We're not just looking for a product manager; we're looking for a visionary who’s ready to redefine the standards of product management. If you’re ready for a role where you'll drive real market impact, we invite you to bring your expertise to our team!

What You Will Be Doing

Align customer and market analysis with strategic objectives, using generative AI to enhance decision-making and efficiency.
Perform in-depth analysis of product costs, pricing, and customer data to optimize profitability and market positioning.
Develop and refine our product offerings, incorporating customer feedback and using AI to create exceptional customer experiences.

What You Won’t Be Doing

Managing the entire product development cycle; your focus will be on high-level strategic planning and decision-making.
Technical product decisions; these are managed by a specialized team, allowing you to concentrate on the commercial aspects.
Engaging in constant cross-functional communication; you are the primary decision-making authority.

Director Of Product Management Key Responsibilities

Driving customer retention through strategic service offerings, informed by generative AI to maximize value creation.

Basic Requirements

At least 7 years of experience in a product management role within a B2B SaaS company
Experience leveraging AI technologies (such as ChatGPT, Claude, or Gemini) in a product management context (for ideation, strategy formulation, etc.)

About Trilogy

Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!

Working with Crossover

This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $200 USD/hour, which equates to $400,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.

What to expect next:

You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.

Important! If you do not receive an email from us:

First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.

description:
About the job
Who We Are

Motive empowers the people who run physical operations with tools to make their work safer, more productive, and more profitable. For the first time ever, safety, operations and finance teams can manage their drivers, vehicles, equipment, and fleet related spend in a single system. Combined with industry leading AI, the Motive platform gives you complete visibility and control, and significantly reduces manual workloads by automating and simplifying tasks.

Motive serves more than 120,000 customers – from Fortune 500 enterprises to small businesses – across a wide range of industries, including transportation and logistics, construction, energy, field service, manufacturing, agriculture, food and beverage, retail, and the public sector.

Visit gomotive.com to learn more.

About The Role

As a Senior Computer Vision Engineer, you will be a part of a passionate team whose mission is to bring intelligence to the world’s trucks. The team is focused on building technology to understand driving behavior, identify risk factors, and intelligently suggest coachable events that not only improves the fleet safety and potentially save millions of dollars but also contribute to making the roads safer. You will have a unique opportunity to work with a high caliber and fast-paced team which consists of experienced researchers and engineers in Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Robotics with a track record of previous products and top-tier publications.

You will play a critical role in building and improving a technology that will be used by millions of trucks. In this role, you will design and implement complex computer vision systems. You will have the opportunity to build and/or improve algorithms for edge processing, implement cloud services, and integrate them to deliver end-to-end product features. You will also get exposure to large-scale ML infra and scaling that facilitates large amounts of data to train, test, and validate computer vision systems.

What You’ll Do

Improve the performance of our models and algorithms already in production
Build and optimize CV/ML algorithms for real-time performance so they can run on our embedded platform i.e. the next-gen AI dashcam
Write proficient Python and C++ code to build and improve CV algorithms, ML services, training, model compression and porting pipelines
Convert state-of-the-art research prototypes into reliably working product features
Collaborate with RnD team working in Computer Vision, Machine Learning, and Robotics, along with ML Platform, Embedded, Backend, and Frontend teams to deliver end-to-end product features
Solve challenging object detection, segmentation, recognition, and geometric computer vision problems.
Build automated deployment, validation, and active learning pipelines.

What We’re Looking For

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field. A Master’s or a Ph.D. degree is a strong plus. 
5+ years of algorithm development experience in the area of Computer Vision, Deep Learning, and Machine Learning. 
Solid mathematical foundation in Computer Vision, Deep Learning, Machine Learning, and optimization approaches.
Hands-on experience in training framework and tools (TensorFlow | Pytorch | Caffe)
Strong experience in Python or C++
Hands-on experience in building embedded algorithms and applications
Experience in the following tools and technologies is a plus. AWS (SageMaker, Lambda, EC2, S3, RDS), CI/CD, Terraform, Docker, and Kubernetes.
Prior experience with optimizing and deploying ML models on embedded devices is a strong plus

Creating a diverse and inclusive workplace is one of Motive's core values. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. 

Please review our Candidate Privacy Notice here.

The applicant must be authorized to receive and access those commodities and technologies controlled under U.S. Export Administration Regulations. It is Motive's policy to require that employees be authorized to receive access to Motive products and technology.
skills: Computer Vision, Data Science, Deep Learning, Machine Learning, and Pattern RecognitionAlgorithm Development, Algorithms, Image Processing, PyTorch, and TensorFlow

description:
About the job
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, gt.school. Have you got what it takes?

Are you a mobile engineer who thrives on complex challenges and is eager to make a real impact? Join our team to contribute to innovative products that deeply leverage AI and that are reshaping industries and changing the way we work and learn.

At gt. school, our focus isn’t just on creating another app; we're pioneering an innovative approach to learning by integrating modern techniques like advanced AI, adaptive computer-based training, gamification, and continuous feedback. At the heart of it all lies TeachTap, an ambitious app that is bringing historical figures to life using AI, offering an engaging, TikTok-like learning experience to make learning more relevant and fun.

Your responsibilities will involve turning UI designs into working app features, fixing bugs, and collaborating with our product and backend teams to maintain smooth functionality. You'll be joining our small, tight-knit development team, contributing to innovation and improving our app's user experience. The pace is fast, but the rewards both personal growth and the tangible impact on students are substantial. In this position, you will have a high degree of ownership and the ability to significantly shape the product to ensure a seamless and intuitive experience for our users.

We're not just using AI as a buzzword. We're at the start of a thrilling journey with generative AI, experimenting and learning to fully leverage its potential and free our engineers from mundane tasks, allowing them to focus on what truly matters: design, decision-making, and understanding the far-reaching implications of different implementation strategies.

Showcase your skills, not just your resume. Take on our challenges: 15-min Cognitive, 90-min Coding, 180-min App-Building. Excel and you'll face a decisive interview with our Hiring Manager. More than half walk away with an offer. Ready to unleash your potential? Apply today!

What You Will Be Doing

Taking high-fidelity UI designs and transforming them into interactive and efficient mobile app features,
Integrating screens with our modern APIs, ensuring data consistency and responsiveness,
Collaborating with product managers and designers to ensure the functionality, reliability, and user-friendliness of the app.

What You Won’t Be Doing

Getting stuck in endless approval loops - we value swift decision-making and autonomy.
Isolated tasks - you will collaborate closely with a supportive product and backend team.

Mobile Application Developer (iOS, Swift) Key Responsibilities

Delivering a high-quality application that serves as the primary interface for students in our cutting-edge computer-based learning environment.

Basic Requirements

At least 4 years of experience developing mobile applications (any platform).
At least 2 years of experience being the primary technical contributor for a development team OR software product.
Experience using React Native for cross-platform app development.

About Gt.school

GT School is an EdTech Startup that leverages technology, AI, and subject matter experts to cultivate a new way of learning. Our unique approach leverages 50+ years of learning science, cutting-edge data analytics and high-performance coaching. In doing so, we can help students learn more, learn faster, and learn better - and have fun while doing it. We are a remote-first company that hires globally via Crossover.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!

Working with Crossover

This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.

What to expect next:

You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.

Important! If you do not receive an email from us:

First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

Crossover Job Code: LJ-4581-PK-Lahore-MobileApplicat.041
job_title: Mobile Application Developer (iOS, Swift), gt.school (Remote) - $100,000/year USD

description:
About the job
About RubyGarage
RubyGarage is a leading software development and consulting company that specializes in building outstanding products for entrepreneurs and enterprises. We thrive on innovation and excellence, and our approach is rigorously analytical, aimed at ensuring quality and efficiency. Our team is deeply involved in continuous learning and adaptation to new technologies and frameworks, which makes RubyGarage an ideal place for professionals who want to grow their expertise in cutting-edge software development practices.

Who we are looking for
We are seeking a dedicated and skilled Business Analyst with experience in software development projects to join our team. The ideal candidate should have a strong background in business process analysis, requirements gathering, and Agile methodologies. This role requires an individual who can bridge the gap between IT and the business, translating complex requirements into actionable project plans and ensuring alignment with business goals.

Responsibilities
Analyzing the market, competitors, and target audience to understand industry trends and gather insights that influence product development strategies.
Identifying buyer personas of target users of a product to tailor solutions that meet their specific needs and preferences.
Developing the value proposition to highlight the unique benefits and selling points of a product
Working with hypotheses and identifying product vision by collaborating with stakeholders to ensure the product aligns with business objectives and customer expectations.
Forming features set and product scope based on validated user needs and strategic business goals, ensuring a scalable product roadmap.
Modeling of business and operational processes.
Identifying, collecting, and formalizing product requirements through various elicitation techniques such as interviews, surveys, and observation.
Creating business, functional, and non-functional specifications that serve as a detailed guide for the development and quality assurance teams, ensuring all requirements are accurately implemented.
Product development road mapping and release planning, organizing the change management process to adapt to evolving requirements effectively.
Keeping the product backlog up to date, prioritizing items based on their strategic value and ensuring clear communication of changes to all team members.
Coordinating work of designers and the development team on the implementation of the product concept, ensuring that the design and functional implementations align with the business goals.
Determining product analysis metrics and analyzing the obtained data to measure product performance against business objectives and user satisfaction.
Performing acceptance testing and providing compliance with specifications, verifying that all product functionalities meet the defined criteria before market release.
Identifying stakeholders, managing cooperation between them, and ensuring stakeholder engagement throughout the software development lifecycle.
Facilitating collaboration and communication between cross-functional teams to maintain a cohesive development environment and align on business goals.
Leading sprint planning, reviews, and retrospectives to ensure continuous improvement in processes and product quality.
Developing and maintaining documentation for requirements, processes, and user guides to support transparency and sustainability.
Guiding and mentoring junior analysts in best practices, tools, and methodologies to foster a knowledgeable and efficient team.

Requirements
At least 1 year as a Business Analyst or Product Manager in an IT company or startup.
Advanced proficiency in English, capable of engaging in technical discussions and producing comprehensive documentation.
Experienced in using Communication Plans, RACI matrices, Stakeholder Registers and other management tools to manage communication and tasks exeution effectively.
Strong background in developing business requirements, product acceptance criteria, and functional specifications.
Proficient in creating use-cases, data flows, acceptance criteria, and functional specifications in the “Given-When-Then” format.
Experience in forming non-functional requirements and creating detailed entity relationship diagrams, data flow diagrams, and UML diagrams.
Solid understanding of business process modeling with knowledge of BPMN (Business Process Model and Notation).
Deep understanding of the SDLC and best practices in a software development environment.
Proficient in Agile methodologies with practical experience in SCRUM environments, ability to act as a Product Owner and facilitate sprint plannings, reviews, and retrospectives if there is such a need.
Ability to conduct thorough market, environment, and competitor analysis with the skill to draw qualitative, sound conclusions from research.
Exceptional ability to explain complex concepts in simple language and engage in productive dialogue.
Willingness to take responsibility for the quality of work performed and initiative to continuously engage with new subject areas (domains).
Knowledge of strategic planning tools such as Lean Canvas, Business Canvas, Operating Canvas, Project Canvas, and Value Proposition Canvas.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to identify and resolve complex issues effectively.
Experience working in cross-functional teams, with the ability to foster a collaborative team environment.
Flexible in adapting to changes with the capability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously under tight deadlines.
Encourages innovation and continuous improvement, not only following best practices but also creating new ones.
Ability to understand customer needs and translate them into effective product features, enhancing user satisfaction and engagement.

We offer
Work on long-term and engaging projects from the USA, Western Europe, and the Middle East, or on the development of the company’s own cutting-edge IT products.
Participate actively in the optimization of Project Management (PM) and Value Analysis (VA) processes within the company, helping to refine and enhance workflows.
Thrive in a work environment with a minimal level of hierarchy, promoting open communication and direct impact on decision-making processes.
Benefit from a structured mentoring program designed to foster your professional growth within the company.
Gain unlimited access to our corporate knowledge base and educational resources, supporting continuous learning.
Experience a management culture that is open to new ideas and initiatives, encouraging innovation and creative problem-solving.
Avail extensive opportunities for both horizontal and vertical growth within the company, allowing you to enhance your career trajectory based on your interests and skills.
Enjoy bi-annual compensation reviews, ensuring your efforts are recognized and rewarded in alignment with achieving business goals.
Take advantage of paid vacation and sick leave, and the opportunity to work remotely from anywhere in the world, offering you flexibility and work-life balance.
Utilize state-of-the-art tools and technologies that facilitate effective analysis, communication, and collaboration across teams.
Work in an inclusive and diverse setting that values each individual’s unique background and perspective, contributing to a rich cultural and professional experience.

Why You?
Are you passionate about technology and innovation? Do you excel in identifying business needs and crafting clear solutions that align technology with strategic business interests? We are looking for someone who is not only skilled in analysis but also proactive in making suggestions and equipped to handle the dynamic challenges of software development projects. If you are driven to deliver exceptional results and thrive in a fast-paced environment, RubyGarage is your stage.

Join us
At RubyGarage, you will work alongside top talent to develop products that have real impacts. We provide an environment where your skills will be challenged and your knowledge will grow. You’ll engage with the latest technologies and work on projects that push the boundaries of what is possible. We value innovation and creativity, and we encourage our team members to bring fresh ideas to the table. With a strong emphasis on work-life balance, continuous professional development, and a supportive team, RubyGarage offers a fulfilling career path for ambitious Business Analysts.
skills: Problem Solving and Requirements GatheringAnalytical Skills, Business Analysis, Business Process, Business Process Improvement, Business Requirements, Data Analysis, Teamwork, and User Acceptance Testing

description:
About the job
About Milliman

Milliman is among the world's largest providers of actuarial and related products and services. The firm has consulting practices in healthcare, property & casualty insurance, life insurance and financial services, and employee benefits. Founded in 1947, Milliman is an independent firm with offices in major cities around the globe.

This position is for Milliman’s office in Pakistan expected to be fully functional in 2024.

Education

Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field. A Master's degree or relevant certification is a plus.
CFA

Key Responsibilities

Develop and implement credit risk models, including Probability of Default (PD), Loss Given Default (LGD), and Exposure at Default (EAD) models.
Perform data analysis and statistical modelling to assess credit risk and forecast potential losses.
Gather, manage, and analyze data for model development and validation.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate credit risk models into business processes and systems.
Prepare comprehensive reports and presentations on model findings, methodology, and performance for senior management and stakeholders.
Stay updated with industry trends, regulatory changes, and best practices in credit risk modelling.
Assist in derivative (Swap) valuation

Qualifications

Proven experience in IFRS 9 modelling, PD modelling, and LGD modelling.
Strong knowledge of databases and data management practices.
Proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint for data analysis and presentation.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and communicate complex concepts clearly.

Preferred Skills

Experience with programming languages such as SQL, Python, R, and VBA.
Familiarity with data visualization tools like Power BI.
Prior experience working at a Big 4 consultancy firm.
Advanced proficiency in Excel, including complex formulas, pivot tables, and data analysis tools.
Strong presentation skills with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical audiences.
Experience in derivative valuation.
skills: Data Analytics, Presentation Skills, and Problem SolvingCredit Risk Management, International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS), Loss Given Default (LGD), Pivot Tables, Presentations, Quantitative Finance, and Visual Basic for Applications (VBA)

About the job
Xgrid is a cloud services tech firm, specializing in providing expert consultancy and professional services in building secure, complex, large-scale, production-grade distributed systems. Our mission is to help businesses grow by equipping them with state-of-the-art tools and technologies, modernizing and building a robust tech stack to satisfy all their use case requirements.

We are looking for passionate SSRS and SQL Developers who have an understanding of designing, establishing, and maintaining data management and reporting systems. Our business group works with top-tier Silicon Valley and European customers to help them build production-grade systems using cutting-edge software technology.

At Xgrid, you will enjoy being part of an extremely talented, motivated team interacting with both business and development counterparts to capture key requirements and translate them into products and services designed for our customers. The ideal Xgrid SSRS and Power BI Developer will have experience developing and delivering complex enterprise-grade mission-critical automated software systems.

If you are passionate about working with the world’s top tech Silicon Valley companies and highly experienced software engineers, and are excited about solving interesting and complex problems and challenges in a fast-paced environment where you can grow and help build a team and culture, Xgrid has a place for you, and we would love to have you onboard!

What You Will Do

Develop Tabular, Matrix, Drill-Down, and Sub Reports using SSRS.
Design an intuitive interface for report creation and customization, accessible without extensive technical expertise.
Establish connections with diverse data sources such as SQL Server, Oracle, OLE DB, ODBC, and XML.
Formulate queries to extract data from various sources, enabling the sharing of datasets across multiple or single reports.
Implement Dynamic Filtering, enabling users to refine data within reports based on parameter values.
Create Custom Calculations and utilize Built-In Functions as needed.
Configure Subscriptions and Delivery, including Data-Driven Subscriptions for personalized report distribution based on predefined criteria.
Enforce Role-Based Security, Item-Level Security, and Data Source Security.
Utilize the Report Manager, a web-based interface for managing reports, data sources, and subscriptions.
Employ the Report Server for centralized storage and processing of reports.
Implement Version Control to manage and track changes across different report versions.
Integrate with SharePoint to deploy and administer reports within a SharePoint environment.
Seamlessly integrate with Power BI to enhance analytics and visualization capabilities.
Embed SSRS reports into custom applications using Report Viewer controls.
Optimize SQL queries to enhance report performance.
Utilize caching and snapshots for efficient storage and retrieval of frequently accessed report data.
Implement load balancing to distribute report processing across multiple servers to manage high-demand scenarios.


Required Skills

Extensive expertise in developing and optimizing SQL Server queries and stored procedures.
Proficient in utilizing SSRS for effective data visualization and reporting.
Comprehensive grasp of data modeling and database design principles.
Hands-on experience with SSIS for the creation and management of ETL processes.
Sound understanding of data engineering principles, including data warehousing, ETL processes, and managing data in JSON and other semi-structured formats.
Knowledgeable about data governance, data quality, and data lineage.
Well-versed in operating systems.
Strong abilities in gathering information and documenting requirements.
Quick learner with a knack for adapting to fast-paced, customer-driven development environments.
Collaborative team player with exceptional teamwork skills.
Outstanding written and verbal communication abilities.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving capabilities.


Preferred Skills

Hands-on experience with building data processing systems and data pipelines.
Decent understanding of SQL (Postgres, MySQL, RDS, etc.) and NoSQL (Mongo, Elasticsearch, Cassandra, DynamoDB, etc.) technologies.
Hands on experience on any Data visualization tool e.g. Power BI, Tableau, Looker etc
Understanding of Cloud database e.g. Azure SQL etc.
Any relevant certifications.


Skills

SQL Server, SSRS, SSIS, Data Engineering, ETL

About the job
A leading US client is seeking Data Scientists.

As a Data Scientist on our team, your daily tasks will involve conducting thorough peer code reviews and offering insightful feedback for improvement. Additionally, you'll collaborate closely with researchers and other stakeholders to align with project requirements.

Job Responsibilities:

Develop Python codes and work on public datasets for extracting information.
Communicate with researchers to stay aware of organizational goals.
Develop code using Jupyter notebooks
Work with available data to address key queries using public sources like Kaggle or others.

Job Requirements

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or similar
Minimum 2 years spent in the role of a data scientist.
2 years specializing in data analysis.
Demonstrated proficiency in Python over 2 years of professional work.
Robust grasp of data science and analysis fundamentals.
Fluent in both spoken and written English.

Nice to have:

Familiarity with SQL is preferable
Excellence in problem-solving and analysis is required.

Job Benefits:

Collaborate with top experts worldwide and join a network aligned with your goals
Enjoy remote work flexibility without traditional job constraints
Competitive global standard salary in USD
Contribute to projects pushing the boundaries of technology, keeping you ahead in your field.

Advance your career journey by joining us now. Complete the assessments and MCQs today to enhance your chances of securing one of our stimulating positions. Seize this opportunity to make a significant impact on our mission and reshape the technology landscape for everyone.

About the job
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Skyvera. Have you got what it takes?

In today's hyper-connected world, network downtime and hardware failures can cripple businesses, costing time, money, and reputation. The industry is plagued with inefficiencies and vulnerabilities, making high network and hardware uptime more critical than ever. Skyvera is rewriting the rulebook by integrating advanced network management with hands-on data center operations. Our engineers leverage cutting-edge technology and top-tier equipment to ensure our clients stay ahead of the curve, setting new standards for reliability and performance.

At Skyvera, we believe in a proactive approach to network and data center management. Unlike typical industry roles, this position uniquely combines expertise in both advanced network management and data center operations, offering a dynamic and multifaceted work environment. This dual focus not only differentiates us from others but also keeps the role exciting and challenging, allowing our engineers to stay ahead of industry standards.

In this role, you will be an integral part of a team dedicated to maintaining and optimizing our network and data center operations. Your expertise will help drive our mission to provide reliable, secure, and efficient network solutions. If you are passionate about working with cutting-edge technology, leading industry equipment, and thrive in a dynamic environment, we encourage you to apply and join us in revolutionizing network and data center management.

What You Will Be Doing

Network Management: Configure and maintain networking systems, including Cisco and F5 equipment, troubleshoot and resolve network issues, and implement robust security measures.
Data Center Management: Maintain and manage data center equipment, coordinate with providers for hardware issues, and ensure the data center is organized and efficient.
System Maintenance and Upgrades: Perform regular hardware maintenance, conduct firmware and OS updates, support software upgrades, and manage equipment moves, migrations, and recycling.
Incident Management: Monitor systems using various tools, manage customer circuits and SDWAN appliances, and administer Windows and Linux systems to ensure quick and effective incident response.

Network Architect Key Responsibilities

Ensure high network and hardware uptime

Basic Requirements

At least 3 years of experience in network and data center management, routing configuration, and troubleshooting
Proficiency in using Cisco network equipment and F5 load balancers
Experience with hardware servers management and preventative maintenance practices
Proficiency in Windows and Linux administration
Experience with SDWAN appliances
Knowledge of SIP and SBC basics
Ability to support hardware maintenance, firmware, and OS updates

About Skyvera

Skyvera maintains your legacy, on-premise software, while reimagining its cloud-native future.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!

Working with Crossover

This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.

What to expect next:

You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.

Important! If you do not receive an email from us:

First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

Crossover Job Code: LJ-5351-PK-Islamaba-NetworkArchite

About the job
Senior Data Engineering & Analytics Specialist

Job Description: 

Highly skilled Senior Data Engineering & Analytics Specialist with over 10 years of experience to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing data solutions to support our organization’s data-driven decision-making processes. As a senior resource, you will lead and mentor junior team members, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and provide strategic insights to optimize our data architecture and analytics capabilities. This role requires a deep understanding of data engineering, analytics, and cloud technologies, as well as proficiency in various tools and programming languages.

Key Responsibilities:
Develop interactive dashboards and visualizations using Power BI to facilitate data-driven decision-making.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and design scalable data solutions that meet business needs.
Design, develop, and implement data pipelines and ETL processes using tools such as Azure Data Factory, SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), and Python.
Create and maintain data models and cubes for analysis and reporting using SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS).
Optimize performance and scalability of data solutions by tuning queries, indexes, and data storage strategies.
Lead the adoption of best practices and emerging technologies in data engineering and analytics.
Mentor junior team members and provide technical guidance and support.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to data quality, performance, and reliability.

Required Skills and Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field; master’s degree preferred.
Minimum of 10 years of experience in data engineering and analytics roles.
Proficiency in cloud technologies, particularly Microsoft Azure (Azure Synapse, Azure Cosmos DB).
Expertise in data modeling, ETL, and data warehousing concepts.
Strong programming skills in Python, Java, or C#.
Extensive experience with Microsoft SQL Server, including SSIS, SSAS, and SSRS.
Hands-on experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Preferred Skills:
Experience with Dynamics 365 CRM and NetSuite.
Knowledge of machine learning and predictive analytics.
Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools for CI/CD pipelines.
